summary: This is a Public Corruption Unit case status update from April 2, 2021, focusing on the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It details significant developments including her indictment, arrest, detention, discovery productions, bail denials, pretrial motions, and efforts to interview Prince Andrew via an MLAT request.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged in a six-count indictment for facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls; arrested and detained; multiple bail applications denied.

persons.name: Pomerantz
persons.context: Prosecutor on the US v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, part of the trial team.

persons.name: Moe
persons.context: Prosecutor on the US v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, part of the trial team.

persons.name: Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor on the US v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, part of the trial team.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The prosecution team is pursuing a potential interview; after his counsel declined a voluntary interview, the team initiated an MLAT request.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Denied Maxwell's pretrial motions but deferred ruling on a suppression motion related to materials obtained via subpoena to a law firm.

connections.description: The prosecution team is pursuing an interview with Prince Andrew as part of the investigation into Maxwell's case.
Pomerantz is an AUSA prosecuting Maxwell.
Moe is an AUSA prosecuting Maxwell.
Comey is an AUSA prosecuting Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's case and has ruled on her pretrial motions.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A grand jury returned a six-count indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at a residence in New Hampshire.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The prosecution team made an initial discovery production in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Discovery Completed
events.description: The prosecution completed discovery in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Second Bail Application Denied
events.description: Maxwell's second bail application was denied.

events.title: Pretrial Motions Filed
events.description: Maxwell filed pretrial motions including motions to dismiss based on the NPA or statute of limitations, motions to suppress materials, and discovery-related motions.

events.title: Prosecution Files Omnibus Opposition Brief
events.description: The prosecution team filed an omnibus brief in opposition to Maxwell's pretrial motions.

events.title: Third Bail Motion Filed and Denied
events.description: Maxwell filed a third bail motion; the prosecution's opposition was due March 9, and her bail appeal to the Second Circuit was recently denied.

events.title: Trial Adjourned to Fall 2021
events.description: The trial in US v. Ghislaine Maxwell was adjourned to the fall of 2021.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on June 29, 2020, on six counts related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.
Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in New Hampshire and has been detained since; multiple bail applications have been denied.
The prosecution is pursuing a potential interview with Prince Andrew and, after his counsel declined a voluntary interview, initiated an MLAT request.
Pretrial motions filed by Maxwell include attempts to dismiss the indictment based on the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) or statute of limitations, and to suppress materials obtained via subpoena.
Judge Nathan denied most of Maxwell's pretrial motions but deferred ruling on a suppression motion related to materials obtained from a law firm via subpoena.
